Mpc Controller¶

Overview¶

This module provides the MPCWeights, MPCController classes for mpc controller functionality.

Examples¶

>>> from src.controllers.mpc_controller import *

API Summary¶

src.controllers.mpc_controller

Detailed API¶

class src.controllers.mpc_controller.MPCWeights(q_x: 'float' = 1.0, q_theta: 'float' = 10.0, q_xdot: 'float' = 0.1, q_thetadot: 'float' = 0.5, r_u: 'float' = 0.01)[source]¶

class src.controllers.mpc_controller.MPCController(dynamics_model, horizon=20, dt=0.02, weights=None, max_force=20.0, max_cart_pos=2.4, max_theta_dev=0.5, use_exact_discretization=True, *, fallback_smc_gains=None, fallback_pd_gains=None, fallback_boundary_layer=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Linear MPC for the double inverted pendulum on a cart.

State (nx=6): [x, th1, th2, xdot, th1dot, th2dot] Input (nu=1): u = cart force

Parameters:

  • dynamics_model (DoubleInvertedPendulum)

  • horizon (int)

  • dt (float)

  • weights (Optional[MPCWeights])

  • max_force (float)

  • max_cart_pos (float)

  • max_theta_dev (float)

  • use_exact_discretization (bool)

  • fallback_smc_gains (Optional[List[float]])

  • fallback_pd_gains (Optional[Tuple[float, float]])

  • fallback_boundary_layer (Optional[float])

__init__(dynamics_model, horizon=20, dt=0.02, weights=None, max_force=20.0, max_cart_pos=2.4, max_theta_dev=0.5, use_exact_discretization=True, *, fallback_smc_gains=None, fallback_pd_gains=None, fallback_boundary_layer=None)[source]¶
Parameters:

  • dynamics_model (DoubleInvertedPendulum)

Return type:

None

set_reference(ref_fn)[source]¶

Set a reference function ref_fn(t) -> R^6 (desired state).

Parameters:

ref_fn (Callable[[float], ndarray])

Return type:

None

compute_control(t, x0)[source]¶

Build and solve a linear MPC QP around the current state x0 at time t. On solver failure/infeasibility, return a safe, angle-aware fallback control.

Parameters:

  • t (float)

  • x0 (ndarray)

Return type:

float
